welcome.welcome1: This tool was created to help teams quickly create a robust and accessible Unified Design System that supports light and dark mode, desktop and mobile applications.
welcome.welcome2: In addition, for each system we will provide a dylexic theme, a non-animated theme (for folks with motion sensitivities) and a color blind theme.
--button-padding: Padding multiplier x var(--spacing-1) for button
--button-border: Border multiplier x var(--border-1) for button
--button-radius: Radius multiplier x var(--radius-1) for button
--button-minwidth: Minimum width multiplier x var(--spacing-1)for button
--primary: Color palette selected color designated by user as the default color theme's primary color
--primary-0: Calculated 0 shade of the color theme's primary color.  0 being the lightest shade and 900 the darkest.
--primary-half: Default color theme's primary color with 0.5 opacity
--primary-quarter: Default color theme's primary color with 0.25 opacity
--primary-100: Calculated 100 shade of the color theme's primary color.  0 being the lightest shade, 900 being the darkest.
--primary-200: Calculated 200 shade of the color theme's primary color.  0 being the lightest shade and 900 the darkest.
--primary-300: Calculated 300 shade of the color theme's primary color.  0 being the lightest shade and 900 the darkest.
--primary-400: Calculated 400 shade of the color theme's primary color.  0 being the lightest shade and 900 the darkest.
--primary-500: Calculated 500 shade of the color theme's primary color.  0 being the lightest shade and 900 the darkest.
--primary-600: Calculated 600 shade of the color theme's primary color.  0 being the lightest shade and 900 the darkest.
--primary-700: Calculated 700 shade of the color theme's primary color.  0 being the lightest shade and 900 the darkest.
--primary-800: Calculated 800 shade of the color theme's primary color.  0 being the lightest shade and 900 the darkest.
--primary-900: Calculated 900 shade of the color theme's primary color.  0 being the lightest shade and 900 the darkest.

--on-primary: The color that will serve as the foreground text color when the background color is the color theme's primary color.  This color will be #121212 or #ffffff, whichever has a 4.5:1 or higher contrast ratio against --primary.
--on-primary-half: The color that will serve as the foreground text color, with opacity 0.5, when the background color is the color theme's primary color.
--on-primary-0: The color that will serve as the foreground text color when the background color is the color theme's primary-0 color. This color will be #121212 or #ffffff, whichever has a 4.5:1 or higher contrast ratio against primary-0.
--on-primary-100: The color that will serve as the foreground text color when the background color is the color theme's primary-100 color. This color will be #121212 or #ffffff, whichever has a 4.5:1 or higher contrast ratio against primary-100.

--dm-primary: The tool calculates this value based on the default color theme's selected primary color.  It will satisfy accessibility standards when used in dark mode.

--background: Holds the value of the primary background color selected by the designer.  Part of the light mode background color pair.
--on-background: The color that will serve as the foreground text color when the background color is the color theme's primary background color for light mode.  This color will be #121212 or #ffffff, whichever has a 4.5:1 or higher contrast ratio against --background
--dm-background: Holds the value of the dark mode primary background color selected by the designer.  Part of the dark mode background color pair
--dm-on-background: The color that will serve as the foreground text color when the background color is the color theme's primary background color for dark mode. This color will be #121212 or #ffffff, whichever has a 4.5:1 or higher contrast ratio against --dm-background
--background-secondary: Holds the value of the secondary background color selected by the designer.  Part of the light mode background color pair.
--dm-background-secondary: Holds the value of the dark mode secondary background color selected by the designer.  Part of the dark mode background color pair
--iconOnTertiary: The color of an icon displayed on a tertiary colored background.
--text-gradient-a: Holds the beginning color value of the text header gradient as selected by the designer
--text-gradient-b: Holds the ending color value of the text header gradient as selected by the designer
--dm-text-gradient-a: The tool calculates this value based on the default color theme's selected text header gradient beginning color. It will satisfy accessibility standards when used in dark mode.
--dm-text-gradient-b: The tool calculates this value based on the default color theme's selected text header gradient ending color. It will satisfy accessibility standards when used in dark mode.
--color-drop: Color used for text-shadow CSS to give text some drop shadowing
--dm-color-drop: Color used for text-shadow CSS to give text some drop shadowing when in dark mode
--surface: Background color used in Theme Builder for Select dropdowns, popovers, alerts, cards, accordions and modals
--on-surface: The color that will serve as the foreground text color when the background color is --surface.  This color will be #121212 or #ffffff, whichever has a 4.5:1 or higher contrast ratio against --surface.
--dm-surface: Background color used in Theme Builder for Select dropdowns, popovers, alerts, cards, accordions and modals in dark mode
--border: Color used in light mode for components that desire to have a border, like cards
--dm-border: Color used in dark mode for components that desire to have a border, like cards
--input-disabled: Background color for disabled input field
--input-hover: Border color when hovering over input field
--dm-input: Dark mode background color for input field
--dm-on-input: Dark mode text color for input field
--dm-input-disabled: Dark mode background color for disabled input field
--dm-input-hover: Dark mode border color when hovering over input field
--focusBlur: The blur radius used on the box-shadow of the focused component.  The larger number, the more blurring.  This is applied to inputs fields and their dropdowns.
--dm-danger: Dark mode background color for danger
--dm-warning: Dark mode background color for warning
--dm-success: Dark mode background color for success
--dm-info: Dark mode background color for info
--dm-on-danger: Dark mode text color for danger
--dm-on-warning: Dark mode text color for warning
--dm-on-success: Dark mode text color for success
--dm-on-info: Dark mode text color for info
--hotlink: The color of hotlinks in light mode
--hotlink-visited: Color of hotlinks that have been visited
--hotlink-decoration: The hotlink text decoration value.  Usually "underline" or "none".
--hotlink-hover-decoration: The hotlink text decoration value when hovered.  Usually "underline" or "none" and usually opposite of hotlink-decoration.
--dm-hotlink: The color of hotlinks in dark mode
--dm-hotlink-visited: Color of hotlinks in dark mode that have been visited
--dm-hotlink-decoration: The hotlink text decoration value in dark mode. Usually "underline" or "none".
--dm-hotlink-hover-decoration: The hotlink text decoration value when hovered in dark mode. Usually "underline" or "none" and usually opposite of hotlink-decoration
--hotlinkOnWhite: The color of a hotlink displayed on a white background.
--hotlinkOnWhite-visited: The color of a hotlink that has been visited, displayed on a white background.
--hotlinkOnWhite-decoration: The hotlink text decoration value on white background. Usually "underline" or "none"
--hotlinkOnWhite-hover-decoration: The hotlink text decoration value when being hovered on a white background. Usually "underline" or "none"
--hotlinkOnBlack: The color of a hotlink displayed on a black background.
--hotlinkOnBlack-visited: Color of hotlinks that have been visited and located on black background
--hotlinkOnBlack-decoration: The hotlink text decoration value on black background. Usually "underline" or "none"
--hotlinkOnBlack-hover-decoration: The hotlink text decoration value when being hovered on a black background. Usually "underline" or "none"
--hotlinkOnTertiary: The color of a hotlink displayed on the tertiary background.
--hotlinkOnGradient3-visited: Color of hotlinks that have been visited and located on grandient-3 background
--hotlinkOnGradient3: The color of a hotlink displayed on a gradient-3 background.
--radius-1: Base radius used in many other variables
--spacing-1: Base spacing used in many other variables
--border-1: Base border used in many other variables
--elevation-horizontal: Base value for horizontal shadow length
--elevation-vertical: Base value for vertical shadow length
--elevation-blur: Base value for shadow blur radius
--elevation-spread: Base value for shadow spread radius
--elevation-1: Elevation 1 contains 5 numbers: offset-x offset-y blur-radius spread-radius color
--reverse-elevation-horizontal: Base value for horizontal shadow length in reverse elevations.
--reverse-elevation-vertical: Base value for vertical shadow length in reverse elevations
--base-elevation-1: Base elevation 1 contains 4 numbers: offset-x offset-y blur-radius spread-radius
--bevel-horizontal: Base value for horizontal shadow length
--bevel-vertical: Base value for vertical shadow length
--bevel-spread: Base value for shadow spread radius
--bevel-blur: Base value for shadow blur radius
--bevel-light-opacity: Opacity applied to the color used to mimic lighting on the element.
--bevel-dark-opacity: Opacity applied to the color used for shading on the element.
--bevel-1: Bevels contains up to 2 sets of 5 numbers each, offset-x offset-y blur-radius spread-radius color.  One set affects the lighting effect, the other the shading effect.  Bevel-1 applies 1 as a multiplier to bevel change to affect horizontal and vertical offset of the light/shadow
--inbevel-horizontal: Base value for horizontal shadow length for inverse bevel
--inbevel-vertical: Base value for vertical shadow length for inverse bevel
--inbevel-spread: Base value for shadow spread radius on inverse bevel
--inbevel-blur: Base value for shadow blur radius on inverse bevel
--inbevel-light-opacity: Opacity applied to the color used to mimic lighting on the element for inverse bevel
--inbevel-dark-opacity: Opacity applied to the color used for shading on the element for inverse bevel
--inbevel-change: Base value for bevel change for inverse bevel
--reverse-bevel-1: Inverse bevel contains 1 set of 5 numbers, offset-x offset-y blur-radius spread-radius color.  This defines the shading effect.  Reverse-bevel-1 applies 1 as a multiplier to bevel change to affect horizontal and 0.1 as a multiplier for vertical offset of the light/shadow
--dropdown-focus-theme: Width of menu item selection color.  Used for controlling left border selection or full-width selection
--on-dropdown-focus-bg: Text color for selected menu items
--dm-dropdown-focus-bg: Menu item selection color in dark mode
--dm-on-dropdown-focus-bg: Text color for selected menu items in dark mode
--dropdown-elevation: The elevation to use for the dropdown
--on-dropdown-hover-bg: Text color for hovered menu items
--dm-dropdown-hover-bg: Text color for hovered menu items in dark mode
--dm-on-dropdown-hover-bg: Text color for hovered menu items in dark mode
--dropdown-radius: Border radius multiplier x var(--radius-1) for dropdown
--icon: Holds the value of the icon color selected by the designer
--on-icon: The color that will serve as the foreground text color when the background color is the color theme's icon color.  This color will be #121212 or #ffffff, whichever has a 4.5:1 or higher contrast ratio against --icon.
--dm-icon: The tool calculates this value based on the default color theme's selected icon color.  It will satisfy accessibility standards when used in dark mode
--dm-on-icon: The color that will serve as the foreground text color when the background color is the color theme's dm-icon color. This color will be #121212 or #ffffff, whichever has a 4.5:1 or higher contrast ratio against dm-icon.
--button-shadow: Shadow for button (combination of elevation and bevel)
--sm-buttonLetterSpacing: Letter spacing for small button in %
--chip: Background color used for chips in Theme Builder
--on-chip: The color that will serve as the foreground color on a chip. This color will be #121212 or #ffffff, whichever has a 4.5:1 or higher contrast ratio against --chip.
--dm-chip: The tool calculates this background value based on --chip. It will satisfy accessibility standards when used for chips in dark mode
--dm-on-chip: The color that will serve as the foreground color on a chip in dark mode. This color will be #121212 or #ffffff, whichever has a 4.5:1 or higher contrast ratio against --dm-chip.
--chip-padding: Padding multiplier x var(--spacing-1) for chip
--chip-radius: Radius multiplier x var(--radius-1) for chip
--chipTypography: Holds the font style value for chip
--p-padding: Padding multiplier x var(--spacing-1) for a paragraph
--section-padding: Padding multiplier x var(--spacing-1) for a section
--card-padding: Multiplier applied to --spacing-1 to provide padding for card
--card-gap: Multiplier applied to --spacing-1 to provide a gap value for card, the distance between the title and body of the card
--card-radius: Multiplier applied to --radius-1 to provide border radius for card
--card-shadow: Used to set the box-shadow for the card.  Combining --card-elevation (horizontal) and --card-bevel (vertical) to form the value.
--modal-padding: Padding multiplier x var(--spacing-1) for modal dialog
--modal-elevation: Elevation to use for modal dialogs
--modal-overlay: Color of overlay behind modal dialog
--toast-padding: Padding multipler x var(--spacing-1) between icon and title
--toast-boxshadow: Shadow for toast (combination of elevation and bevel)
--image-elevation: Elevation to use for image border
--inline-image-height: Inline image height multiplier x var(--spacing-1)
--avatar-border: multiplier applied to --border-1, used for border thickness on smaller and medium sized avatars
--avatar-border-lg: multiplier applied to --border-1, used for border thickness on larger sized avatars
--avatar-elevation: holds the value of the elevation selected by the designer
--avatar-shadow: Used as the box-shadow style value for avatars, equal to --avatar-elevation
--sliderbarHeight: Height multiplier x var(--spacing-1) for the slider bar
--sliderhandleHeight: Height multiplier x var(--spacing-1) for slider handle
--sliderhandleRadius: Radius multiplier x var(--radius-1) for slider handle
--sliderhandleElevation: Elevation to use for slider handle
--popoverShadow: Shadow for popover (combination of elevation and bevel)
--hero-gap: Multiplier applied to --spacing-1 to provide a gap value for card, the distance between the title and body of the Hero
--hero-padding: Multiplier applied to --spacing-1 to provide a padding value for Hero
--hero-justify-content: The justify-content style value for the Hero
--standard-LineHeight: The value of the line-height css style for the body, captions, labels, and text input form controls.
--header-LineHeight: Not currently used by Theme Builder
--sm-LineHeight: Not currently used by Theme Builder
--fontWeight-0: The relative boldness/thickness of the characters used for decorative and non critical text.
--fontWeight-1: The relative boldness/thickness of the characters used for standard body text.
--fontWeight-2: The relative boldness/thickness of the characters used for headers and smaller, but important, text
--fontWeight-3: The relative boldness/thickness of the characters used for emphasized text.
--fontWeight-4: The relative boldness/thickness of the characters used for text of great importance.  Such text should be used sparingly.
--primaryFont: The family name for the primary font which is used for the body and small text scenarios.
--secondaryFont: The family name for the secondary font which is used for Displays and Headers.
--baseFont: The base font size from which all typography sizings will be calculated.
--headerChange: Not currently used by Theme Builder
--headerWeight: Not currently used by Theme Builder
--bodyFamily: The name of the font family used in body text like labels.
--Display1FontSize: The font size used in a Display1 header, in px.
--Display1FontFamily: The name of the font family to use for Display1 headers.
--Display1FontWeight: The relative thickness of the characters in a Display1 header
--Display1LineHeight: The line height used in Display1 headers, in %.
--Display1TextDecoration: The text decoration used in Display1 headers.
--Display1TextTransform: The text transformation used in Display1 headers.
--Display1LetterSpacing: The letter spacing used in Display1 headers, in %.
--Display2FontSize: The font size used in a Display2 header, in px.
--Display2FontFamily: The name of the font family to use for Display2 headers.
--Display2FontWeight: The relative thickness of the characters in a Display2 header
--Display2LineHeight: The line height used in Display2 headers, in %.
--Display2TextDecoration: The text decoration used in Display2 headers.
--Display2TextTransform: The text transformation used in Display2 headers.
--Display2LetterSpacing: The letter spacing used in Display1 headers, in %.
--h1FontSize: The font size used in a H1 header, in px.
--h1FontFamily: The name of the font family to use for H1 headers.
--h1FontWeight: The relative thickness of the characters in a H1 header
--h1LineHeight: The line height used in H1 headers, in %.
--h1TextDecoration: The text decoration used in H1 headers.
--h1TextTransform: The text transformation used in H1 headers.

--inline-image-radius: Border radius multiplier x var(--radius-1) to use for inline image
--dm-primary-half: The currently calculated dm-primary color with 0.5 opacity
--dm-primary-quarter: The currently calculated dm-primary color with 0.25 opacity
--on-text-gradient-a: The color that will serve as the foreground text color when the background color is the color theme's text header gradient beginning color. This color will be #121212 or #ffffff, whichever has a 4.5:1 or higher contrast ratio against text-gradient-a.
--dm-on-text-gradient-a: The color that will serve as the foreground text color when the background color is the color theme's dm-text-gradient-a color.  This color will be #121212 or #ffffff, whichever has a 4.5:1 or higher contrast ratio against dm-text-gradient-a
--on-text-gradient-b: The color that will serve as the foreground text color when the background color is the color theme's text header gradient ending color. This color will be #121212 or #ffffff, whichever has a 4.5:1 or higher contrast ratio against text-gradient-b.
--hotlinkOnTertiary-visited: Color of hotlinks that have been visited and located on tertiary background
--hotlinkOnTertiary-decoration: The hotlink text decoration value on tertiary background. Usually "underline" or "none"
--hotlinkOnTertiary-hover-decoration: The hotlink text decoration value when being hovered on a tertiary background. Usually "underline" or "none"
--on-input-disabled: Text color for disabled input field
--on-primary-quarter: The color that will serve as the foreground text color, with opacity 0.25, when the background color is the color theme's primary color.
--dm-on-primary-half: The color that will serve as the foreground text color, with opacity 0.5, when the background color is the color theme's dm-primary color.
--dm-on-primary-quarter: The color that will serve as the foreground text color, with opacity 0.25, when the background color is the color theme's dm-primary color.
--hero-titleTypography: The font style value for the Hero's title
--hero-titleTransform: The text-transform style value for the Hero's title
--hero-titleSpacing: Letter spacing for Hero's title in %
--hero-bodyTypography: The font style value for the Hero's body content
--hero-bodyTransform: The text-transform style value for the Hero's body content
--hero-bodySpacing: Letter spacing for Hero's body content in %
--dm-dropdown-focus-theme: Width of menu item selection color in dark mode.  Used for controlling left border selection or full-width selection
--dm-hotlinkOnWhite: The color of a hotlink displayed on a --dm-white background in dark mode.
--dm-hotlinkOnWhite-visited: The color of a hotlink that has been visited, displayed on a --dm-white background in dark mode
--dm-hotlinkOnWhite-decoration: The hotlink text decoration value on --dm-white background in dark mode. Usually \"underline\" or \"none\"
--dm-hotlinkOnWhite-hover-decoration: The hotlink text decoration value when being hovered on a --dm-white background in dark mode. Usually \"underline\" or \"none\"
--dm-hotlinkOnBlack: The color of a hotlink displayed on a --dm-black background in dark mode.
--dm-hotlinkOnBlack-visited: Color of hotlinks that have been visited and located on --dm-black background in dark mode
--dm-hotlinkOnBlack-decoration: The hotlink text decoration value on --dm-black background in dark mode. Usually \"underline\" or \"none\"
--dm-hotlinkOnBlack-hover-decoration: The hotlink text decoration value when being hovered on a --dm-black background in dark mode. Usually \"underline\" or \"none\"
--dm-hotlinkOnTertiary: The color of a hotlink displayed on a --dm-background-tertiary background in dark mode.
--dm-hotlinkOnTertiary-visited: The color of a hotlink that has been visited, displayed on a --dm-background-tertiary background in dark mode.
--dm-hotlinkOnTertiary-decoration: The hotlink text decoration value on --dm-background-tertiary background in dark mode. Usually \"underline\" or \"none\"
--dm-hotlinkOnTertiary-hover-decoration: The hotlink text decoration value when being hovered on a --dm-background-tertiary background in dark mode. Usually \"underline\" or \"none\"
--dm-hotlinkOnGradient3: The color of a hotlink displayed on a --dm-gradient-3 background in dark mode.
--dm-hotlinkOnGradient3-visited: The color of a hotlink that has been visited, displayed on a --dm-gradient-3 background in dark mode.
--accent-0: Calculated 0 shade of the color theme's accent color.  0 being the lightest shade and 900 the darkest.
--accent-100: Calculated 100 shade of the color theme's accent color.  0 being the lightest shade and 900 the darkest.
--accent-200: Calculated 200 shade of the color theme's accent color.  0 being the lightest shade and 900 the darkest.
--accent-300: Calculated 300 shade of the color theme's accent color.  0 being the lightest shade and 900 the darkest.
--accent-400: Calculated 400 shade of the color theme's accent color.  0 being the lightest shade and 900 the darkest.
--accent-500: Calculated 500 shade of the color theme's accent color.  0 being the lightest shade and 900 the darkest.
--accent-600: Calculated 600 shade of the color theme's accent color.  0 being the lightest shade and 900 the darkest.
--accent-700: Calculated 700 shade of the color theme's accent color.  0 being the lightest shade and 900 the darkest.
--accent-800: Calculated 800 shade of the color theme's accent color.  0 being the lightest shade and 900 the darkest.
--accent-900: Calculated 900 shade of the color theme's accent color.  0 being the lightest shade and 900 the darkest.
--icon-half: Default color theme's icon color with 0.5 opacity
--iconHalfOnWhite: The color of an icon displayed on a white background with 0.5 opacity
--iconHalfOnBlack: The color of an icon displayed on a black background with 0.5 opacity
--dm-icon-half: Default color theme's dm-icon color with 0.5 opacity
--oniconOnTertiary: The color that will serve as the foreground text color when the background color is the color theme's iconOnTertiary color. This color will be #121212 or #ffffff, whichever has a 4.5:1 or higher contrast ratio against --iconOnTertiary
